item.description:
Here's another great free event in Boston: A Tour of Italian Opera - this was RESCHEDULED as it rained on August 9th!

We'll meet in Christopher Columbus waterfront park (near the Aquarium). Bring a snack and a drink along with you and something to sit on, perhaps...I'll bring a colorful blanket and a Meetup sign.

 

 

Opera Boston is pleased to be a part of the 2011 Waterfront Performing Arts Series, presented by the Mayor’s Office of Arts, Tourism, and Special Events. The performance is free and open to all!

 Join engaging young Opera Boston artists for a tour of Italian opera through the ages. They’ll perform some of the greatest Italian and Italian-language opera highlights—arias, duets, and even a sextet—from the seventeenth century to the dawn of the twentieth. Great composers from all over the world have written Italian operatic masterpieces: Donizetti, Rossini, Puccini, Handel, Mozart, and more! Don’t miss this fun-filled evening in the beautiful North End— look forward to seeing you there!

 

(This is a free public event but I charge $1 pp per event to help cover my Meetup organizer fees.)
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at 5.45 pm on the grass in the park - I'll have a Mexican blanket and a Meetup sign.
